instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3437B: What is 820-3437B? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVBAT_G3H_CONN: What is PPVBAT_G3H_CONN? This is the where the batteryâ€™s power rail connects to the motherboard. .
definitions.PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_R: What is PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_R? This is a power rail between the battery and a current sense resistor before the battery power feeds current to the rest of the machine. .
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.CHG_AMON: What is CHG_AMON? This is a typo of CHGR_AMON When you see CHG_AMON, assume they meant to type CHGR_AMON.
definitions.CHG_BMON: What is CHG_BMON? This is a typo of CHGR_BMON When you see CHG_BMON, assume they meant to type CHGR_BMON.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B battery problem
threads.message:
[FONT=arial][SIZE=16px]Hi everyone, I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with a strange problem: It has a liquid damage, does not start without a connected charger, the LED turns orange and the battery always remains at 0%.
I checked if there was oxide on the board, I cleaned everything and I did a 150 ? reflow on the SMC chip. for a few minutes it came back to work properly and the battery charged with normal percentage increase but then the problem recurred.
I removed the SMC chip and reballed but I did not solve it.
using the original battery this is not recognized, using a compatible battery is recognized but remains at 0% and lightning appears on the battery symbol.

<TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR> I have B GATE and <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_R</SIGNAL> at 8.6Volts when the charger is connected[/SIZE]

[SIZE=16px]on <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CONN</SIGNAL> I have 7.17Volts and it does not increase

Can you help me? thank you[/SIZE][/FONT]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B battery problem
threads.message:
[SIZE=16px]Post diode mode to ground on both SCL/SDA lines of battery bus; also voltage.[/SIZE]

"[FONT=arial][SIZE=16px]It has a liquid damage"
Which area?

You may need to remove and clean the battery connector; even to change it[/SIZE][/FONT]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B battery problem
threads.message: Ok so you have a CHARGING issue NOT a recognizing the battery issue, so reballing the SMC was pointless. Check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> and report what you get. What voltage do you get on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> with just the charger no battery?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B battery problem
threads.message:
I forgot to mention, post exact voltage for <SIGNAL>CHGR_A</SIGNAL>/BMON; both charger and battery connected.
Also post exact ohm value (measured onboard) for <RESISTOR>R7180</RESISTOR>/81.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B battery problem
threads.message:
the liquid damage was very light, there was a little oxide on the trackpad / keyboard, but nothing was visible on the board.

resistance on pin 17-18 -------- 3.6 ohm
resistance on pin 27-28 --------20.0 ohm

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 8.60 Volts without battery, only charger

<RESISTOR>R7180</RESISTOR> ------- 100k correct
<RESISTOR>R7181</RESISTOR> ------- 62k correct

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B battery problem
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>CHG_AMON</SIGNAL> is 0.25Volts
<SIGNAL>CHG_BMON</SIGNAL> is 0.05Volts

both battery and charger connected

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B battery problem
threads.message:
Give more time to the battery with lightning symbol.
Check System Report about battery.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B battery problem
threads.message: Yeah sounds to me like bad battery. Let it charge for about 30 minutes. If it doesn?t, try a new one

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B battery problem
threads.message: I tried several batteries, only with one in particular is detected. the others are not recognized. what is detected remains at 0% on the system info the battery is present but is not charging. the lightning bolt appears on the battery symbol at the top right

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B battery problem
threads.message: Ok so the lightning bolt doesn't change over and says "Battery is not charging"? If so, I suspect maybe a bad <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B battery problem
threads.message: Post exact readings in diode mode (red probe to ground) for SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B battery problem
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B battery problem
threads.message: SCL and SDA lines readings 0.493 in diode mode

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B battery problem
threads.message:
If battery is recognized, its bus should be good.
I recommend to test a known good battery.
